
# READMEZY
[![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT)

**A quick and easy way to set up a professional looking README using node. Thhis app**

## Table of Contents


[Installation Instructions](#installation-instructions)

[Usage Information](#usage-information)

[Contribution Guidelines](#contribution-guidelines)

[Collaboration Credits](#collaboration-credits)

[Questions](#questions)
[License](#license)


## Installation Instructions

Clone the repository and set up node environment
## Usage Information

Run node index.js to start the program. Follow prompts. Your README.md file will be saved in the 'dist' directory.
## Contribution Guidelines

Anyone can submit
## Collaboration Credits

So far it just me. However, it is important to note that this was a boot camp assignment and I was given a small amout of starter code to begin.}
